page_analysis.text_content:
Basements
&
Excavated
features

Floor area regulations
are intended to address
the building mass and
the appearance of the
streetscape. Therefore,
if basement area is
below grade and does
not contribute to the
apparent mass of a
building, that area,
even if it is habitable,
need not be included in
the total floor area.

Code sections
Page 40
18.12.090 (a, b, & c)
Page 41
18.12.090 (c)
Page 43
18.12.090 (c) (1)
Page 44
18.12.090 (c) (2)

40

Basement standards

• May not be located in special flood hazard areas.
• May not extend beyond building footprint.
• May not encroach into required yards, except where
main dwelling is permitted to extend into rear yard.

FAR
Basements (even habitable ones) do
not count as floor area if first floor
is no more than 3' above grade.

Fig 35 Basement & grade

Excavated features

There are two types of excavated features:
• Light wells and stairwells
• Below-grade patios

FAR
Excavation will not affect grade or
measurement of floor area if stan-
dards are met (see pages 42 and 43).

Fig 36 Excavated feature & grade

A: distance between top of first floor
and grade if excavation meets the
size/dimensional limits described in
Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.

B: distance between top of first
floor and grade if excavated
features exceed the
size/dimensional limits described
in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.

Top of first floor

Basement
Excavated
feature

Grade if excavated features
meet standards described in
Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.

Grade if excavated features
exceed standards described in
Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.

visual_elements.description: A cross-section diagram illustrating a basement and grade. It shows the ground level with a hatched pattern, and a structure partially embedded in the ground. The diagram is labeled 'Fig 35 Basement & grade'.

A cross-section diagram illustrating an excavated feature and grade. It shows a building with a 'Basement' section and an 'Excavated feature' section. The ground level is indicated by a hatched pattern. Two vertical arrows, labeled 'A' and 'B', measure distances from the 'Top of first floor' to different 'Grade' lines. 'Grade' is shown at two levels, one for features meeting standards and another for features exceeding standards. The diagram is labeled 'Fig 36 Excavated feature & grade'.

technical_specifications.parameter: First floor height above grade for FAR exclusion (basements)

qualifiers.text: except where main dwelling is permitted to extend into rear yard
if excavation meets the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43
if excavated features exceed the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43
if standards are met (see pages 42 and 43)

conditions.text: first floor is no more than 3' above grade
May not be located in special flood hazard areas
May not extend beyond building footprint
May not encroach into required yards
basement area is below grade and does not contribute to the apparent mass of a building
excavation meets the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43
excavated features exceed the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43

logical_relationships.expression: Basements (q1) do not count as floor area IF c1
IF c5 THEN that area, even if it is habitable, need not be included in the total floor area.
Excavation will not affect grade or measurement of floor area IF c8 (q5)

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if basement area is below grade and does not contribute to the apparent mass of a building.
If c5 is true, then the basement area (even if habitable) is not included in the total floor area.
Evaluate if the first floor of basements (even habitable ones) is no more than 3' above grade.
If c1 is true, then basements (even habitable ones) do not count as floor area.
Evaluate if basements are located in special flood hazard areas.
Basements must not be located in special flood hazard areas (c2 must be false).
Evaluate if basements extend beyond building footprint.
Basements must not extend beyond building footprint (c3 must be false).
Evaluate if basements encroach into required yards, considering the exception for main dwelling extending into rear yard.
Basements must not encroach into required yards, unless the exception (q2) applies (c4 must be false, or q2 must be true).
Evaluate if excavation meets the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.
If c6 is true, then 'A' represents the distance between top of first floor and grade.
Evaluate if excavated features exceed the size/dimensional limits described in Figs 39-40 on pp. 42-43.
If c7 is true, then 'B' represents the distance between top of first floor and grade.
Evaluate if standards for excavation are met (referencing pages 42 and 43).
If c8 is true, then excavation will not affect grade or measurement of floor area.
